head.supplied: Office of Lands and Survey, ¶ Melbourne 25th May, 1877, ¶ Sir, ¶ ¶ I have the honor to acknowledge receipt of your letter of the 22nd Instant, No 2364, calling attention to your letter of the 4th Ide...

div.p: From William Henry Archer to William Odgers
M77/6114, unit 965, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 860 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
To proof.
Office of Lands and Survey,

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p: I have the honor to acknowledge receipt of your letter of the 22nd Instant, No 2364, calling attention to your letter of the 4th Idem, in which you enquire if any reports of the Melbourne Botanic Gardens for the years 1864 to 1873, beyond those specified in the margin thereof have been received in this Department.
In reply I beg to state that no record can be traced in this Office of the reports alluded to.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be
